text: hello
i am integrating my calling extension to HubSpot

i want use HubSpot's calling sdk in my extension. But sources of sdk are nodejs file. But i am using javascript. Therefore i can't import nodejs files. I need cdn link. Can HubSpot provide cdn link..?

@chanel Hi I am facing the issue with 404 error page URL
Currently my error page URL is *domain/blogs/sdfs*
But I need *domain/sdasd*
No need the *"/blog"* just after domain name bellow the current url of 404 error page i don't need blogs in this url

Hi I tried to add Whatsapp to my inbox today, but at step 3 I have to give up the phone number connected to the Whatsapp business account. It won't accept my current phone number I use for business whatsapp. Has to be a new one. Somebody experience with this?

Hi - does anyone know if loop index, first and last are available in the rss email module?
I’d like to add in the #Index of each item as part of the title
<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/blog/set-up-blog-subscription-emails#set-up-your-blog-subscription-emails>

Hello!
Does HubSpot have a vulnerability scanning tool?
you mean for security risks?

Hello everyone, do you know how can i have a module with configurable background color that i can repeat twice in a page with different colors? i used a config var in the fields, but the last one is changing the background of the first one
Yes, we have a customer asking for this tool. But I don't know if HubSpot has such a tool.

Add a colorpicker field in the module and output the value as an inline style:

```<section class="image-text" {% if module.bg_color.color %}style="background-color:{{ module.bg_color.color }}"{% endif %}> ```

no i dont think so, however you can give your clients a lot of options to secure the website with HubSpot provided tools. More on that here ( see section "Domain Security Settings"): <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/domains-and-urls/ssl-and-domain-security-in-HubSpot>
however you can also just add a background color natively with the Section style:
i was using css classes and if i put 2 of the same module in the same page, the last one overwrites the styles (i had them in a <style> tag inside a css class)
i could try with a style attribute directly in the item

Guess it depends how you build your modules. We don’t use HS sections at all, but build modules that act as sections that are dragged into the DND area. In that case module backgrounds do no affect one another
im not using the section tag, should i?
Shouldn’t matter. A div should suffice
ok, thanks
but if you reference your module in a section.html file, i guess that’s the issue
we avoid the section.html’s to cut down on HTML bloat
mmm yes, i was asked to build the pages as templates
i start a new page, and i dropped in differentes places my module
where it says drop modules
and i tried to change color in bboth
but the last one overwrites the first one
ok, its seems to work the following:
its needed to change inline styles, with the attribute styles... it does not work with classes (at least for me)
like in classes i can have a default styling, but if i need to change it, style attribute is the way to go
thank you very much! first time working with HubSpot
other thing to keep in mind, i have 0 issues doing like i was before asking here
the magic happens when i use {% scope_css %}
rare thing, when you upload a templete with hs upload, it does not let you upload files that contains that

Hi friends! I have an issue where a particular line causes our production page to crash:

```{% set all_locations = hubdb_table_rows('all_locations') %}```
But if I limit results, the page loads and works as expected:

```{% set all_locations = hubdb_table_rows('all_locations', 'limit=106') %} ```
What would be a good way to dive in and debug the HUBL? Is this the right channel to seek help? :pray:
<https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/CBA9UA4EN/p1668618325215249>
Can anyone tell me the situations when exactly HubSpot automatically adds URL redirects?
Glad you got it working. I don’t use scope_css or anything. I just use the default section background function or inline styles in the module template :slightly_smiling_face:

Does anyone know best practice for doing language translation on the blog article publish date ( rendered using `{{ content.publish_date }}` ) -- and also for translating hard coded text (eg: "All posts" as shown in screenshot)?
Not aware if it is best practice but you can manipulate both publish date format and hardcoded text strings through content.language.languageTag
For API
<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/contacts>

Yes, you can only filter by owner ids but you could technically make your own field for owner email address, you would need to fill it out every time you create a contact though, or have a workflow do it
Hi, Is there a way to see, in the design tools, where (on which pages) a specific template or module is used?
right click on the asset (template/module/css/js) and click on *show dependents  <@UFQG8G2Q4>*
